candidates.name: Tim Gilbertson
candidates.why_elect: Because instead of bitching and whinging about how useless politicians are, like most of us do, I am prepared to try and do something about it.
candidates.why_stand: My philosophy is that an honest individual serving the long term interest of the entire region is a better option that a group funded and influenced by wealthy localised sector interests, especially where water security is concerned. I see my role as that of an honest individual.

candidates.name: Peter Guerin
candidates.why_elect: I grew up here then returned in 2015. I understand local government and its importance to communities. I have the time, energy, knowledge and commitment to make a difference. I will focus on the important matters that make a real difference to the environment and prosperity of our region.
candidates.why_stand: The regional council must do more to improve regional prosperity—by operating better, faster, cheaper, and making things easier for residents. With my 20 years experience as a local authority CEO, I can make a significant contribution to the debate and make a difference to regional policy.

candidates.name: Mary O'Neill
candidates.why_elect: I live in Hawke's Bay 14 years and I have a wealth of experience in the native plants research in Hastings and Havelock North. I completed 2 assignments in my majors on gastric outbreak 2016 in Havelock North prior I graduated with Bachelor of Applied Science Environment.
candidates.why_stand: I stand for Hastings constituency that encompasses Hastings, Havelock North and Clive. People choose to live here and call this place home. We have a great climate and potential to build environmental knowledge that will drive sustainable innovation—which would make us excellent. I will open that door!

candidates.name: Rick Barker
candidates.why_elect: Two council terms ensures I have a good grasp of the issues and processes. Great progress has been made in that time on all fronts and I wish to be part of the continuing improvement. Central government experience, with six years at the cabinet table provides good governance experience.
candidates.why_stand: The regional council is the environmental leader for our region, I wish to see it be an exceptional leader at improving water quality, that people swim in, fish thrive, help with water storage and conservation, lead on mitigating climate change while encouraging economic development.

candidates.name: Tom Belford
candidates.why_elect: I am super-diligent, with a reputation for digging into complex issues and advocating effectively. As editor of BayBuzz magazine, I listen—I am constantly exposed to the wide range of issues facing the community and the concerns people have.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the economic and social well-being of our region must be built on the foundation of a healthy, sustainable environment. Our present council majority shares that vision and I am seeking re-election to stay on that course.

candidates.name: Craig Foss
candidates.why_elect: I walk the environmental and changing climate talk; starting at home, fencing streams; planting countless native trees; removing pests, creating a QEII conservation block and installing solar energy. My Backing The Bay for 12 years as a MP balanced with 14 years of banking demonstrates my governance and business experience.
candidates.why_stand: We need the Right Balance. Our families, communities and businesses views, values and expectations for transparency and accountability need to be around the council table. Havelock North, Hastings and Flaxmere residents will now have a clear choice.
